text:
Shannon has been cranking out some amazing beers lately, and their red is one of the better reds I've tasted. Really delicious beer, I would love to try it on tap with a half and half blonde

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
(Draught) Pours a clear reddish orange body with a small off-white head. Aroma of caramel, herbs, grain, and earth. Flavor of caramel, nuts, earth, bread, and toffee with a moderately dry finish.
12oz can. Clear copper color with ivory head. Mild caramel, floral aromas. Spicy caramel, herbal, floral flavors---easy finish___not bad.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Man, what is there to say about this? It tastes like horsefeed initially. Thats the problem with malty beers. They are a molasses and barley cocktail. Eventually you forget it and just drink it out of habit. Without habits, this beer stays in the keg.
Clear amber with a lasting head. Malty aroma with very little visual carbonation. Medium body with more malt. Hoped nicely to bring out the malt in this one. Finishes dry.
On tap at Craft Pride. Pours a clear copper with medium off white head. The aroma is grass and grain. Medium mouth, bready malt, toast, light bitterness, decent.
Clean medium copper hue, 2 fingers of solid off white head. nose is toasted malt. Little more sweet than bitter. Middle is biscuit and soft dried fruit. Finish is dry and medium in length. Nice.

12 ounce can thanks to secret santa Cajun! Hazy dark red-amber, large foamy tan head, good retention. Aroma of intense caramel and crystal malt. The taste is caramel, earth, mild cherry and currant. Medium bodied, high carbonation. A little disjointed but still pleasant.

Can. Pours a dark orange-red-amber with a high, solid, fine-grained, sticky, lacy, off-white head. Nose is raisin bread, roast pecans, treacle, citron, and gentle spice. Solid malt backbone on the tongue with a touch of sweetness; good crusty wheat bread overtone, with roast bitterness underneath. Substantial and authoritative; often Irish reds are wimpy. This ones not. Finish is bitter and clean. I like this beer.

12 oz. can (from Texas Micro 10 pack) served in a shaker- poured a transparent darkened red/maroon color, thin white ring about the glass for a head that did show some evidence of lacing. Aroma of earth, unbaked bread that is proved and ready for some heat, and some light yeast. Hits the mouth with a medium body, malt isnt awash in over sweetness for once, toffee sensations in the middle, finish has a spot of cream that dries out over time. Interesting brew, and decent.

whoa! very solid brew. this is 2 for 2 from this brewery. Malty is most of aroma; copper pour. nice above average palate/thickness! Taste was mostly malt but just the right amount of hops to balance - easy drinker!

Frisco, Tx. - Mashd Restaurant - on tap. Neutral aroma with a slight earthy funk to it, Dark copper pour, thick khaki colored head, nice lacing. Earthy flavor, some sweet toffee notes. bready, some cotton candy sweetness in the back end. Very unique flavor for an Irish Ale. Thick enough mouthfeel.
Pours a deep red color with dark off-white head. Caramel, roasted malt, and bread on the nose; follows onto the palate. Medium bodied. Finishes with bread and toffee.

The aroma is a light maltiness, hints of caramel, bread and a little roasty. Pours a clear amber with a small light brown head, mostly diminishing and very little lacing. The taste is a light dry bitter. The body is medium, the texture creamy, the carbonation lively and the finish bitter. Not bad.
Poured a deep garnet with a sustaining light head. Pure malt in the mouth with a faint hop background. Very nice.
Bottle, amber garnet color with off white foam, aroma is malty caramel, nice red ale with good balance of malt and some soft hop notes , smooth finish

On tap at WOB Arlington. Deep red with a decent off-white head. Aroma is of toffee, toast, caramel, fruit cake, and nuts. Taste is of toffee with hazelnuts, toast, caramel, light earthy notes. A very well done beer.
On tap at Rodeo Goat. Amber pour with a white head. Aroma is caramel, earth, and a little sweetness. Taste is caramel, dirty hops, and a thin finish.

Tap at Rodeo Goat. Pours a fairly clear orange color with a light white head. Aroma is sweet malts, sugar and light grains. Flavor is sweet, malty, light grains and more sweet notes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at the brewery. Light red pour with an off white head. The aroma has some toffee notes and grass. The flavor is very similar, with some very earthy hop character and some toffee and caramel. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation. I am not a fan of red ales, so the score will not be as high as it likely would be for someone who is a fan of the style.
